Make a custom column plot

Source: R/custom_plots.R
INTERNAL_make_customDataPlot.Rd

Make a custom plot of column (i.e., sample) data, using a user-specified function to generate coordinates.

.make_customDataPlot(id, all_memory, all_coordinates, se)

Arguments

id

Integer scalar specifying the index of the current custom column plot.
all_memory

list of DataFrames, where each DataFrame corresponds to a panel type and contains the settings for each individual panel of that type.
all_coordinates

A list of data.frames that contain the coordinates and covariates of data points visible in each of the plots.
se

A SingleCellExperiment object.

Value

A list containing cmd_list, xy and plot, equivalent to the output of .plot_wrapper. A cached field is also returned containing the result of evaluating the user-specified function.

Details

This function will try to use the input cached coordinates if possible. In particular, it will only regenerate the coordinates if a user transmits a restricting selection to the custom column plot, and the selection differs from what is in the input cached (based on differences in the names of the selected samples).

For the output cached, the idea is that it will be stored in the main iSEE function. It can then be passed to this function upon future re-plotting of the custom column plot.

If the selected custom column function is "---", this function will return NULL in cmd_list; a data.frame with no rows in xy; an empty ggplot in plot; and NULL in cached.

See also

.process_custom_selections, .text2args

Contents

  • Value
